name: George Verwer
description:
George Verwer (1938 - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker George Verwer in mp3 format. Founder of Operation Mobilization an missions organization that sends out full-time and part-time missionaries to many countries in the world. One of the burdens of brother George has been to distribute powerful literature to Christians such as: "The Calvary Road by Roy Hession," and many others. 

George Verwer has written many books including the powerful book: "Come, Live, Die!" He has mobilized and encouraged thousands of Christian workers to fulfill their calling in the Lord to reach the lost world with the Gospel of Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: 1) Ministry From Spring Harvest - Chapter 1
sermons.description: The key to this passage, and its application, is the fact that Daniel “resolved”. Verwer focuses on God’s providence, and Daniel’s resolve, holiness and perseverance. The holiness must be presented in a culturally-contextualized way so as to properly demonstrate a clear message. "Theological tidbits" and extremism must be avoided to keep them out of the way of the message.

sermons.title: 19 Reasons Why I Am Going To Urbana
sermons.description: Prayer for Urbana is emphasized, that God would raise up workers for the harvest fields. Verwer is strongly encouraged by university movements and their effectiveness. "The Holy Spirit is the CEO of all missionary work", and in reaching people both at Urbana and through the audio produced there He is the one we work alongside. Interdenominational focus provides a great foundation, centered on the key truths of Scripture and laying aside the all else. Encouragement of the younger generation must be a key priority.

sermons.title: 2) Ministry From Spring Harvest - Chapter 3
sermons.description: Pressures surround every Christian; the fear of death, society, peers, accusations and backbiting. To face these we must have courage, or spiritual toughness, just as the men in this passage did. Deliverance by God is amazing, and the enemy will sometimes be destroyed by their own methods. The most important thing is always the presence of God in the trial, as he was in the furnace.

sermons.title: 3) Ministry From Spring Harvest - Chapter 5
sermons.description: Verwer emphasizes that God will let failures happen; he will not always overrule and save us from ourselves. When this happens we should not expect that he will withhold judgment. Daniel’s wisdom is shown yet again not only in translating the message from God but in his refusal to take the gifts the king offered for his service.

Verwer clearly shows how the lack of holiness and church vibrancy in our day is simply that we forsook the prayer meetings 50 years ago. sermons.title: 6) Blessings and 6 Barriers
sermons.description: Verwer focuses on commitment with balance. He discusses the blessings that encourage him most, including relationships with ex-OMers that have been healed by forgiveness. New frontiers, wisdom, and humility all figure prominently. "It's unlimited what can be accomplished if you don't care who gets the credit". Unfortunately there are also barriers to be overcome. Manpower can be a limiting factor, especially as the local church learns to focus on the priorities. Money, gossip and prayerlessness are all vices that can immobilize a movement.

sermons.title: Balance, Not Tangents
sermons.description: Verwer explains that balance is not compromise but is holding various strong scriptural truths in the light of other strong scriptural truths. He lists many tangents that need to be avoided. Although we must "not be nibblers of the possible but grabbers of the possible" this needs to be held in balance with common sense. There are many tensions that need to be maintained between seeming opposites in the journey to being more Christ-like.

Avoiding narrow-mindedness is key when trying to accomplish the Great Commission together with all of our brothers and sisters in Christ. Divisions between denominations and views of the Holy Spirit must be minimized as we seek to "fellowship with all of God’s people

sermons.title: Being an Encourager
sermons.description: Miscommunication can take the best-intentioned encouragement and turn it to discouragement. Therefore love must overrule in all attempts to encourage. Verwer warns of the danger of "making the narrow road narrower than it is!" Forgetfulness and extremism are to be avoided. The importance of prayer combined with writing letters cannot be underestimated. Visiting people whenever possible is vital to the encouragement process.

sermons.title: Building Loyalty
sermons.description: For the leader of a largely volunteer run organization an important question is how to build loyalty with those volunteers. Some steps to be taken are to focus on biblical, holy spirit filled, balanced leadership. It is hard to get people to unite and stay on course. At the same time intellectual honesty and openess must be maintained. Leadership and serventhood must go hand in hand. A good leader seeking to have loyal team members must take time to communicate with people and win their hearts. Verwer emphasizes that loyalty can exist in a balanced, non-cultish form.

sermons.title: Going Somewhere
sermons.description: In a broad overview of world missions Verwer covers several important issues. ``We need theology, but we need theology to be on fire`` says Verwer, emphasizing the need for vision in addition to training. Our focus cannot be distracted; ``We must be God-centered``. Vision must lead to strategy, and then we must take our strategy to God in prayer. Judging others ministries should not happen if we rely on contextualization and sensitivity. On the job training and follow up are also key factors in seeking to reach a lost world for Christ.

sermons.title: Loyalty
sermons.description: For the leader of a largely volunteer run organization an important question is how to build loyalty with those volunteers. Some steps to be taken are to focus on biblical, holy spirit filled, balanced leadership. It is hard to get people to unite and stay on course. At the same time intellectual honesty and openess must be maintained. Leadership and serventhood must go hand in hand. A good leader seeking to have loyal team members must take time to communicate with people and win their hearts. Verwer emphasizes that loyalty can exist in a balanced, non-cultish form.

sermons.title: Playing At Soldiers
sermons.description: George Verwer gives a impassioned strong appeal to a group of young missionaries to give up their life's fully to the Lord Jesus Christ. He gives many allusions of warfare and being a solider and strongly shows how many Christians are not living fully towards their goal and task for the great commission. This is a call to true discipleship and forsaking of the world for Christ.

Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker George Verwer in mp3 format. Founder of Operation Mobilization an missions organization that sends out full-time and part-time missionaries to many countries in the world. One of the burdens of brother George has been to distribute powerful literature to Christians such as: "The Calvary Road by Roy Hession," and many others. 

George Verwer has written many books including the powerful book: "Come, Live, Die!" He has mobilized and encouraged thousands of Christian workers to fulfill their calling in the Lord to reach the lost world with the Gospel of Jesus Christ.
